item.title: Frankie add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "It soared, a bird, it held its flight, a swift pure cry, soar silver orb it leaped serene, speeding, sustained, to come, don't spin it out too long long breath he breath long life, soaring high, high resplendent, aflame, crowned, high in the effulgence symbolistic, high, of the ethereal bosom, high, of the high vast irradiation everywhere all soaring all around about the all, the endlessnessnessness..." -- James Joyce

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Unfortunately for the betterment of mankind it is not always the fair-minded who are in the right." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Truth, in matters of religion, is simply the opinion that has survived." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "To go wrong in one's own way is better then to go right in someone else's." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Despite the enormous quantity of books, how few people read! And if one reads profitably, one would realize how much stupid stuff the vulgar herd is content to swallow every day." -- Voltaire

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Ivan Turgenev
item.description: "Nature cares nothing for logic, our human logic: she has her own, which we do not recognize and do not acknowledge until we are crushed under its wheel." -- Ivan Turgenev

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Frankie add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Lorraine Hansberry
item.description: "The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely." -- Lorraine Hansberry

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Though much is taken, much abides; and though We are not now that strength which in old days Moved earth and heaven, that which we are, we are; One equal temper of heroic hearts, Made weak by time and fate, but strong in will To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Anton LaVey
item.description: "It’s too bad that stupidity isn’t painful." -- Anton LaVey

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "What is the meaning of life? That was all- a simple question; one that tended to close in on one with years, the great revelation had never come. The great revelation perhaps never did come. Instead, there were little daily miracles, illuminations, matches struck unexpectedly in the dark; here was one." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Frankie add a quote by Fulke Greville
item.description: "Oh, wearisome condition of humanity, Born under one law, to another bound; Vainly begot, and yet forbidden vanity, Created sick, commanded to be sound." -- Fulke Greville
